name: dozzle
description: Dozzle is a lightweight, real-time log viewer for Docker containers. It runs as a container and provides a web UI to browse and filter logs across containers, making it easy to debug and monitor running services.
features: Real-time logs: Stream container logs live in the browser with automatic updates as new entries appear.
Multi-container view: Browse logs from all running containers in a single interface with quick switching.
Search and filter: Find specific log entries using text search and filter by container, time range, or log level.
Log streaming: Follow logs in real-time similar to docker logs -f without command-line access.
Container stats: View CPU, memory, and network usage for each container alongside log output.
Multi-host support: Connect to multiple Docker hosts and view logs across distributed container environments.
No dependencies: Run as a single lightweight container without databases or complex configuration requirements.
Authentication support: Protect log access with basic auth or proxy authentication for secure multi-user environments.
